2.2.1 - Cut Subgrade Testing - Cohesive Soil Shear Vane
Detail - NZ Geotechncial Society 2001 - Guideline for Hand Held Shear Vane Test
○ This test shall be undertaken at the design subgrade level to a depth of 2-3m below the design subgrade level
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Average Minimum SU: > 60kPa
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - 4 test per 400M2
2.2.2 - Cut Subgrade Testing - Cohesive Soil Scala Penetrometer
Detail - NZS4402:1988, Test 6.5.2 - Dynamic Cone Penetrometer
○ Scala penetrometer testing to be undertaken instead of shear vane tests where shear vane is unable to penetrate subgrade material
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Minimum 3 blows per 100mm penetration
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - 4 test per 400M2
2.3.1 - Cut Subgrade Testing - Granular Soil Scala Penetrometer
Detail - NZS4402:1988, Test 6.5.2 - Dynamic Cone Penetrometer
○ This test shall be undertaken at the design subgrade level to a depth of 2-3m below the design subgrade level
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Minimum 3 blows per 100mm penetration
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - 4 test per 400M2

Detail - NZS4407:2015, Test 4.3 Nuclear Moisture Density Gauge (Backscatter Mode)
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Ave >95% of MDD
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - 1 set (5 tests) per 400mm lift (every 2nd lift) of fill per 1000m2 of placed

Detail - The Contractor shall carry out compaction trials of the various soil types and combinations on site, and any imported fill materials, using different layer thicknesses, types of rollers and conditioning plant (ie construction discs and scarifiers). The trials shall be conducted over the duration of the earthworks operation with the objective of determining the most suitable and efficient techniques to meet the compaction requirements. The trial details, test data and conclusions shall be reported and copied to the Engineer within five days of completion of each trial.
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) -
Detail - NZS4402:1988, Test 6.5.2 - Dynamic Cone Penetrometer
○ Scala penetrometer testing to be undertaken instead of shear vane tests where shear vane is unable to penetrate subgrade material
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Minimum 5 blows per 100mm penetration

Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Minimum 1 test per 500m3 of filling evenly distributed over the extent and depth of the filling. A minimum of 1 test per 500mm lift or part thereof to be completed through the full lift thickness.
Detail - NZS4407:2015, Test 4.3 Nuclear Moisture Density Gauge (Backscatter Mode)
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Ave >95% of MDD
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - 1 set (5 tests) per 400mm lift (every 2nd lift) of fill per 1000m2 of placed

Detail - Pumice Sand Material shall be contained with an outer layer of fill with a minimum thickness of 600mm. Must be Hardfill and/or imported Type A1 material and/or Type A2 material and/or Type A3 material
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) -
6.1.2 - Topsoil Placement on cut and fill embankments
Detail - Confirmation of thickness and material suitability
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Meets spec and thickness requirements as per drawings
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Once per lot after topsoil re-spread
Detail - The Contractor shall inform the Engineer two days in advance of planned instrument readings so that the Engineer may observe the work.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - 2 days notice to Eng
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Every Time
Detail - Results will be submitted to the Engineer within 1 day of reading the instruments
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - To Engineer within 1 day of Reading
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Every Time
Detail - The Contractor shall take 3 sets of baselines readings from all instruments at 2 day intervals
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Every 2 days
Detail - During active fill placement, the Contractor shall read all monitoring plates twice a week or every 1 metre of fill whichever is more frequent
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - To Engineer within 1 day of Reading
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Twice a week
7.1.5 - Readings During No Active Earthworks in Area
Detail - The Contractor shall read all monitoring plates weekly if there is no active earthworks taking place in the area
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - To Engineer within 1 day of Reading
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Weekly

Detail - The criteria for terminating the embankment preload are either: Three consecutive measurements indicating the t90 settlement value has been achieved, A rate of settlement less than 10% of the maximum rate measured immediately after the fill was completed. The settlement readings shall be evaluated by the Engineer to assess the need to extend the monitoring.
○ 3 Consecutive Measurements showing T90 settlement value achieved
○ Rate of settlement less than 10% of the maximum rate measured immediately after the fill was completed
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Engineers Approval

Detail - As-Built records and drawings shall accurately record the layout and extents of all the work including all of the cuts and fills, monitoring instrumentation, ground improvements, and locations of foundation / subsurface drainage systems and their outlets.
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - During Earthworks
